results.title: Fate makes all the moves
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Idit Benjamin and ACMI
results.brief_description: Idit Benjamin and her husband’s courtship is a love story played out across two continents.This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.

results.title: A Fishy problem
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Astrid Silberman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Astrid Silberman attempts to recreate her family recipe for Gefilte fish. She has trouble deciding whether to follow the traditional recipe or to come up with a new interpretation on the old tradition. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Astrid Silberman and ACMI
results.description: Astrid Silberman attempts to recreate her family recipe for Gefilte fish. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.

results.title: Ingredients of love
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jenni Klempfner and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jenni Klempfner explores her ancestors’ Polish and Jewish heritage as well as her own multi-cultural family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jenni Klempfner and ACMI

results.title: I'm not French
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Alain Herz and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alain Herz examines his ethnicity, tracing it back to his parents Jewish/Polish background, his upbringing in Belgium and his eventual migration from France to Australia. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Alain Herz and ACMI
results.description: Alain Herz examines his ethnicity, tracing it back to his parents Jewish/Polish background, his upbringing in Belgium and his eventual migration from France to Australia. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.

results.title: Second life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ximena Silberman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ximena migrated to Australia in 2003. To migrate is to be born again. While enjoying her new life in Australia, she looks back at the friendships and life she left behind in Buenos Aires. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ximena Silberman and ACMI
results.description: Ximena migrated to Australia in 2003. To migrate is to be born again. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia

results.title: The Shoemaker
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Adam Nudelman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Artist Adam Nudelman asks himself why he always paints shoes? Behind these objects lies a story about family and loss and brings him closer to his Jewish heritage. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Adam Nudelman and ACMI

results.title: My beautiful shwesters
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Adam Barolsky and ACMI
results.brief_description: Adam Barolsky laments the distance he has put between himself and his sisters to find a better life. He tells a tale of deep sorrow and concern for the welfare of the family he has left behind. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Adam Barolsky and ACMI

results.title: The Circle = Dayereh = Il Cerchio [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jafar Panahi Film Productions, Mikado Film Srl (Rome), Lumière & Co. and Jafar Panahi
results.brief_description: From Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi (The White balloon), comes The Circle” a tale of female oppression in modern day Iran. “The Circle opens in a hospital maternity ward where a woman has just given birth. Her mother is horrified by the catastrophic outcome - its a girl. She had been assured (via ultrasound) that it would be a boy and laments the fact that a divorce will ensue and her daughter will be shamed. This opening sequence reflects the status of women in Iran, as unwanted, second-class citizens without rights or a voice in society. “The Circle” tells the stories of several women in a city over the course of one day and night. Simple acts of buying a bus ticket or smoking a cigarette in public are denied to women and are punishable by law. The women of the film, in constant danger of imprisonment and harassment, are shunned by their families and seek refuge with each other. Panahi adopts a documentary style for this feature film, as street noise fills the soundtrack and the camera follows the characters around, almost hounding them. “The Circle” was banned in Iran due to its controversial subject matter. In Farsi with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Lion, Best Film at the 2000 Venice Film Festival)

results.title: Sir Jack Brabham: The complete history of a motor racing legend
results.creator_credit: Neville Hay and Hay Fisher Productions
results.brief_description: Brabham - one of the great names in motor racing history. A great driver who not only became a household name worldwide during the 1950’s and 60’s for his driving exploits, but who also created a racing team that was still winning in the 1980’s. This story of Sir Jack Brabham, told exclusively in his own words and by close associates including Stirling Moss, Roy Salvadori and and John Cooper. Extensive archival material captures the feel of some glorious motor racing while tracing every step of a truly brilliant career.

results.title: Steam across the mountains: the story of the Zig Zag Railway
results.creator_credit: Nick A'Hern Productions, ABC Video and Nick A'Hern
results.brief_description: The Zig Zag Railway is regarded as an engineering marvel and a mecca to students of engineering the world over. This fascinating video follows the Zig Zag’s colourful history from its early days in the great commercial steam era, to its closure in 1910 and through to its restoration as a tourist railway in 1975. This program uses the Zig Zag Railway as a working model to bring to life the romance adventure and style of the Great Australian Steam Era. Highlights include: complete stereo soundtrack, breathtaking footage shot entirely on 16mm film and loads of steam trains to see and hear!
